providerAddress.formatted_address: Woodrush Community Hub, Shawhurst Lane, Hollywood, Birmingham B47 5JW, United Kingdom

enrichment.AboutCourse:
The primary course is designed in conjunction with local schools in our alliance partnership. The course combines the theories of learning and teaching, alongside developing practical insights and skills in the effective teaching and assessment of young children. It will look into the study of teaching in all National Curriculum subjects, with emphasis on English, Maths, Science and ICT. School Direct provides hands on school-based learning that will develop analytic and reflective practitioners. \r
The course includes two placements at contrasting schools over two key stages. Training is coordinated by the School Direct 'Lead School' with a combination of observations, seminars, workshops, tutorials and practical sessions.
enrichment.Qualifications:
In order to apply for a place on Primary School Direct, you must have a UK undergraduate 2:1 degree or a recognised equivalent qualification. A 2.2 will be considered if the applicant has a wide variety of school experience.\r
\r
A GCSE grade C/4 in English and Mathematics for those applying to teach secondary. \r
A GCSE grade C/4 in a Science as well as English and Mathematics if you are applying to teach primary. \r
\r
It is a requirement that applicants have passed, or have plans in place to pass, the Professional Skills Tests in numeracy and literacy.
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Application forms are considered by both the university and the individual schools involved with Woodrush Teaching School Alliance. \r
\r
All successful applicants will have been interviewed and this will normally take place at Woodrush Teaching School Alliance. The University and the Woodrush jointly design and manage the interview process with the school leading the process. Applicants that demonstrate professionalism, commitment, a realistic understanding of the pressures of the course and the profession, an awareness of the school in which they are intending to train, creativity, organisational skills and a clear recognition of the need to synthesise practical and academic learning through refection are most likely to succeed.
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
If you studied outside the UK, you should visit the National Academic Recognition Centre (NARIC) website to find out whether your qualifications are of an equivalent level to UK GCSEs, A levels and an undergraduate degree. \r
\r
It is a requirement that applicants have passed, or have plans in place to pass, the Professional Skills Tests in numeracy and literacy.
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
Successful School Direct students will be those that have a clear understanding of schools in England and of what good teaching involves \r
\r
Recognise that the job of the teacher is first and foremost that of teaching and that the understanding of the pedagogy of teaching and learning is fundamentally essential \r
\r
Have a solid knowledge of their subject(s) and are always committed to further developing this knowledge base \r
\r
Are committed to the education of all children, whatever their need and background \r
\r
Are able to reflect on their own experiences and apply learning to future actions \r
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
We aim to place you at a school with the minimal travelling distance. You will have two placements at contrasting schools. For primary you will teach ages 3 to 11 and for secondary ages 11 to 18. Woodrush TSA partner with over twenty schools in and across the Midlands and these can all be found at www.woodrushtsa.co.uk.\r
\r
We have listed the locations that our partner schools will be running placements for the next year. You should indicate your preference of location on your application, this does not guarantee you will be placed at your preferred location. Throughout the year a schools staffing may change and therefore a school not listed may become available in your subject.

inst.TrainWithUs:
Woodrush Teaching School Alliance is an excellent place to start your teaching career. We aim to develop outstanding practitioners who are creative, highly effective and exceed the professional standards. Educational theory, innovative research and outstanding pedagogy are the foundations of our highly successful training programme. This was recognised by Ofsted in 2013 Leaders' procedures to ensure that the quality of teaching continues to improve and to support those teachers new to the profession are exemplary. Staff work as a close effective team, sharing good practice and providing support for each other . \r
\r
Woodrush High School, the lead in our teaching school alliance, is a consistently OFSTED Outstanding 11-18 school on the border of Birmingham and Worcestershire. We place an emphasis on ensuring all of our students achieve the qualifications, and equally important the life skills, to be successful in the world we live in.  We have hardworking and well qualified staff who are dedicated to delivering an ever-changing curriculum in a vibrant and exciting way. The curriculum we offer is broad, balanced and inspires students to learn. \r
 \r
Woodrush works with over twenty schools both primary and secondary in and across the Midlands. In order to provide you with a variety of experience you will be placed at two schools with the alliance. These will be chosen based on your location.
inst.TrainWithDisability:
We welcome our duties under the Equality Act 2010 to eliminate discrimination, advance equality of opportunity and foster good relations in relation to age (as appropriate), disability, race, gender reassignment (maternity and pregnancy), religion and belief, sex and sexual orientation.\r
\r
Treating people equally does not necessarily involve treating them all the\r
same. Our policies, procedures and activities must not discriminate but must nevertheless take account of differences of life-experience, outlook and background, and in the kinds of barrier and disadvantage which people may face,

AccreditingProviderEnrichments.Description:
Studying at Warwick means you’ll be taught and supported by highly experienced practitioners. Known nationally for the quality of their training they are a top-ranked university in the Midlands, with Ofsted Outstanding ITT courses.\r
If you study with Warwick, you’ll become a confident teacher, able to make a difference to young people's development. You'll see learners engaging in active and independent learning, and they will develop their knowledge and grow into young adults under your care.\r
\r
Warwick provide you with the skills needed to forge a strong personal and professional identity, which you will continue to develop throughout your career.

Studying at Worcester provides an immersive and inspiring, school-centred training route into teaching.  The innovative design and delivery of the course places the trainee at the heart of a thriving school community from day one.\r
\r
At Worcester you will benefit from their excellent partnerships with schools throughout the West Midlands region and beyond. They also provide state of the art facilities to support your research, subject knowledge and communication skills - enabling you to deliver teaching with impact.\r
\r
Graduates enjoy excellent employability prospects as the majority of their partner schools offer early career teaching posts to our PGCE trainees.

The University of Birmingham's School of Education has a long-standing reputation as a centre of excellence for teaching and research in a wide range of areas of educational practice and policy. It is an international leader in education and has a history of top rated research.\r
\r
Awards include being ranked 39th in the World and 10th in Europe in the 2018 QS World Rankings and rated 'outstanding' in their latest Ofsted inspection (2013) for its Teacher Training programmes. They also have the prestigious award of being ranked fifth for Education in The Times Good University Guide 2018.
